alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 22 at 4:40PM MDT until April 22 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northeastern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Western Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Eastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 439 PM MDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles east of Dulce to 18 miles south of Pueblo Pintado, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 53 and 123. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 83 and 178. Locations impacted include... Chama, Cuba, Dulce, Tierra Amarilla, Navajo Dam, Nageezi, Regina, Counselor, El Vado and Lindrith. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval
